snippet: Differing responses to the mob killing in Kabul of a mentally troubled woman accused of burning the Quran show how Afghans’ commitment to Islam can clash with Western values of individual rights.
abstract: Mentally ill Afghan woman is beaten to death and her body burned by angry mob at shrine in Kabul after being accused of burning pages from Quran; many city residents are horrified at mob's justification of the killing as a commitment to Islam, but some say act was justified if she had indeed burned pages of the Quran.

byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and AHMAD SHAKIB

lead_paragraph: Differing responses to the mob killing in Kabul of a mentally troubled woman accused of burning the Quran show how Afghans’ commitment to Islam can clash with Western values of individual rights.

headline.main: A Day After a Killing, Afghans React in Horror, but Some Show Approval
headline.print_headline: A Day After a Killing, Afghans React in Horror, but Some Show Approval
